div.a: Lake Pend Oreille Alternative High School

div.font: The Idaho State Board of Education has extended the soft closure of Idaho public school districts through the end of the school year.
Facilities will be allowed to reopen if they meet guidelines that will be determined at the Idaho School Board's meeting on Thursday, April 16th and with approval from local public health officials.

span.font: LPOSD will continue facilitating essential services and student learning

font.span: Buildings will be closed. Check back frequently for updates.
Read more on our LPOSD - COVID-19 Information and FAQs page.

span.font: April 6th- April 30th our office will be closed due to Governor Little’s Stay-Home Order.

font.span: During this time if you need to contact this office please call 208-263-2184.
are available to individuals 18 years of age and under at the following 4 sites.

sack will also be provided to students at Farmin Stidwell and Kootenai Elementary Schools. Breakfast, lunches and dinners (at select locations) are served weekdays only. As of NOW children do not need to be present to pick up meals. Parents/legal guardians and siblings can pick up meals for children under 18 years of age.

span.font: Clark Fork Jr./Sr. High School 11 am- 1 pm PST
Farmin Stidwell Elementary School 11 am- 1 pm PST

font.u: Southside Elementary School 11 am- 1 pm PST

font.span: Has your income decreased due to recent events? If so, it is a great time to complete a new 'Low Income Eligibility' application so that when school resumes, your family already has their new eligibility updated with no meal service delays. The Low Income Eligibility application meal form can be found at this link
and under child nutrition on our district web page down in the center, middle. This institution is an equal opportunity provider.
